title: Words That Look Alike
description: Some English words look nearly identical but have completely different meanings. Can you tell these tricky lookalikes apart?

questions.question: What is the difference between 'desert' (noun, stress on first syllable) and 'dessert'?
options: Desert is a dry area; dessert is a sweet course
Both mean the same thing, just different spellings
Desert is a sweet; dessert is abandonment

questions.question: Which word means 'to praise highly': 'complement' or 'compliment'?
What does 'principal' mean when used as a noun?
options: The head of a school or a sum of money

questions.question: 'Elicit' and 'illicit' look similar. What does 'illicit' mean?
What is the difference between 'emigrate' and 'immigrate'?
options: Emigrate means to leave a country; immigrate means to enter a new one
Emigrate is British; immigrate is American
Emigrate refers to birds; immigrate refers to people

questions.question: Which word means 'to go before': 'precede' or 'proceed'?
'Discreet' and 'discrete' differ by one letter. What does 'discrete' mean?
What does 'adverse' mean, as opposed to 'averse'?
Which is correct: 'The building was _____ by the earthquake'?
'Stationery' and 'stationary' â€” which one means writing materials?
What does 'amoral' mean, as opposed to 'immoral'?
options: Lacking any moral sense or standards

questions.question: 'Prescribe' and 'proscribe' are near-opposites. What does 'proscribe' mean?
What does 'perspicacious' mean, as opposed to 'perspicuous'?
options: Having keen mental perception and insight

questions.question: 'Ingenious' and 'ingenuous' look similar. What does 'ingenuous' mean?
